Package javelin.model.world

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Caravan, Incursion, Location, ParkedVehicle, PointOfInterest, Quest.QuestMarker, Squad
    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An independent overworld feature. If you're creating a new actor type don't forget to update Actor#getallmapactors()!
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean allowedinscenario
      TODO probably better to handle this the way DungeonWorld does.
      boolean impermeable
      If true this actor will be ignored by Incursions.
      Realm realm
      Which team this actor belongs to or null if neutral.
      boolean unique
      Unique actors are those whose names are very unlikely to appear twice in the same World.
      int x
      x coordinate (-1 when uninitialized).
      int y
      y coordinate (-1 when uninitialized).

    • Field Detail

      • x

        public int x
        x coordinate (-1 when uninitialized).

      • y

        public int y
        y coordinate (-1 when uninitialized).

      • realm

        public Realm realm
        Which team this actor belongs to or null if neutral. If null during construction, in which case it won't be updated by place().

      • impermeable

        public boolean impermeable
        If true this actor will be ignored by Incursions.

      • allowedinscenario

        public boolean allowedinscenario
        TODO probably better to handle this the way DungeonWorld does.

      • unique

        public boolean unique
        Unique actors are those whose names are very unlikely to appear twice in the same World.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor()
        Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Permanently removes this actor from the game.

      • place

        public void place()
        Adds this actor to the game. Should only be used once in theory.

      • move

        public void move​(int tox,
                 int toy)
        Move actor to the given coordinates.

      • destroy

        public abstract java.lang.Boolean destroy​(Incursion attacker)
        Called when an incursion reaches this actor's location.
        Parameters:
        incursion - Attacking incursion.
        Returns:
        true if this place gets destroyed, false if the Incursion is destroyed or null if neither.
        See Also:
        Incursion#ignore(Incursion), Incursion.fight(int, int)

      • registerinstance

        protected void registerinstance()
        Called during construction to setup World.actors.

      • deregisterinstance

        protected void deregisterinstance()
        Removes this instance from World.actors.

      • displace

        public void displace​(int depth)

      • cancross

        protected boolean cancross​(int tox,
                           int toy)

      • displace

        public void displace()
        Moves actor to nearby square until a free square is found.

      • turn

        public void turn​(long time,
                 WorldScreen world)
        Called on each instance once per day.
        Parameters:
        time - Current hour, starting from hour zero at the beggining of the game.

      • interact

        public abstract boolean interact()
        Called when a Squad enters the same world square as this actor.
        Returns:
        true if the World should react after this interaction.
        Throws:
        RepeatTurn

      • setlocation

        public void setlocation​(int x,
                        int y)
        Note that this doesn't place() or update the actor in any way.
        Parameters:
        x - World coordinate.
        y - World coordinate.

      • distance

        public double distance​(int xp,
                       int yp)
        Returns:
        Distance from this actor to the given coordinates.

      • getrealmoverlay

        public Realm getrealmoverlay()
        Returns:
        The given realm color will be drawn on the WorldScreen. null means no overlay.
        See Also:
        Realm.getawtcolor()

      • getcombatants

        public abstract java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()

      • getimage

        public abstract java.awt.Image getimage()
        Returns:
        Visual representation of this actor.

      • describe

        public abstract java.lang.String describe()
        Returns:
        Textual representation of this actor.

      • isadjacent

        public boolean isadjacent​(Actor active)
        Returns:
        true if both these actors are touching each other in the WorldScreen.

      • findnearest

        public Actor findnearest​(java.lang.Class<? extends Location> targets)

      • setlocation

        public void setlocation​(Point p)
        TODO ideally would be nice to chance all .x .y to .location (Point)

      • getlocation

        public Point getlocation()

      • distanceinsteps

        public int distanceinsteps​(int xp,
                           int yp)

      • getdistrict

        public District getdistrict()
        Note that this could return a hostile town!
        Returns:
        A Town district this location is part of or null if it is not located inside one. If more than one district encompasses this location, the one with the highest Town.population will be returned.

      • sortbydistance

        public <K extends Actor> java.util.List<K> sortbydistance​(java.util.List<K> actor)

      • accessremotely

        public void accessremotely()
        Called when players click on a World Location that is not adjacent to the currently active Squad.

      • getel

        public abstract java.lang.Integer getel​(java.lang.Integer attackerel)
        Called when an Incursion reaches its target (and for selecting targets).
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level... (may pass null to locations which should be "absolute" EL)
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed for places that should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int), ChallengeCalculator.calculateel(List)

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Returns:
        true if this actor actually exists at its x:y coordinate. If not, it has probably been remove()d from the World map.

      • see

        public boolean see()
        Returns:
        See WorldScreen.see(Point).
        See Also:
        Scenario.fogofwar, reveal()

      • reveal

        public void reveal()
        Reveals this actor's tile to the player, making it visible on the WorldScreen. Note that a non-stationary actor may again become hidden if it moves into a obscured tile.
        See Also:
        see(), Scenario.fogofwar
